alert.note: Alert for Morrill (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 25 at 11:21AM CDT until August 25 at 2:45PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is continuing. * WHERE...Portions of panhandle Nebraska and western Nebraska, including the following counties, in panhandle Nebraska, Cheyenne. In western Nebraska, Morrill. * WHEN...Until 130 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1021 AM MDT, local law enforcement reported heavy rain ongoing. Minor flooding is continuing as water recedes from very heavy rainfall earlier this morning. Between 1 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sidney, Lodgepole, Dalton, Gurley, Colton, Sunol, Sidney Airport, Brownson and Lorenzo. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
